desc: Neural networks, architectures, and training techniques
name: Deep Learning Fundamentals

note_models.name: ML Interview Card

fields: How does backpropagation work in neural networks?

Forward pass: Compute predictions and loss
Backward pass: Compute gradients using chain rule
Chain rule: ∂L/∂w = ∂L/∂y × ∂y/∂z × ∂z/∂w
Update: w = w - α × ∂L/∂w (gradient descent)
Deep Learning Fundamentals
interview_concept
What is the vanishing gradient problem and how do ReLU activations help?

Problem: Gradients become exponentially small in deep networks
Cause: Repeated multiplication of small derivatives (sigmoid saturation)
ReLU solution: Gradient is 1 for positive inputs, 0 for negative
Benefits: No saturation for positive values, computationally efficient
Deep Learning Fundamentals
interview_concept
How do Convolutional Neural Networks (CNNs) work?

Convolution: Sliding filters detect local features
Pooling: Downsampling reduces spatial dimensions
Parameter sharing: Same filter applied across entire image
Translation invariance: Features detected regardless of position
Deep Learning Fundamentals
interview_concept
What is the difference between LSTM and GRU?

LSTM: 3 gates (forget, input, output) + cell state
GRU: 2 gates (reset, update) + hidden state
LSTM: More parameters, better for complex sequences
GRU: Fewer parameters, faster training, similar performance
Deep Learning Fundamentals
interview_concept
What is dropout and how does it prevent overfitting?

Method: Randomly set fraction of neurons to zero during training
Effect: Prevents co-adaptation of neurons, acts as ensemble
Test time: Use all neurons but scale outputs by (1-dropout_rate)
Benefits: Regularization, improves generalization
Deep Learning Fundamentals
